name: unseasoned
content:
unseasoned adjective
(FOOD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
Unseasoned food has not had salt, pepper, herbs, or spices added to it: Add the unseasoned breadcrumbs. Add salt if you use unseasoned chicken stock.
More examplesFewer examplesUse plain white bread, unseasoned or preseasoned with sage.Sprinkle the meat with unseasoned meat tenderizer.Try to get unseasoned olives, in brine rather than dried.

unseasoned adjective
(WOOD)
Unseasoned wood has not been left to dry in the usual way before being used: He makes sculptures of unseasoned wood. The use of green, unseasoned timber is thought to be a reason for the church's crooked spire. Synonym
green (NOT READY)
More examplesFewer examplesThe unseasoned oak is sourced from managed woodlands.The wood used was hard, unseasoned, and difficult to work.

You can also find related words, phrases, and synonyms in the topics:
Building: carpentry & joinery
unseasoned adjective
(PAN)
An unseasoned iron pan has not been protected with oil: Rusting is common in unseasoned cast iron pans. You can buy unseasoned, "bare" cast iron cookware.

unseasoned adjective
(PERSON)
not having a lot of experience of doing something and therefore not knowing how to do it well: Only an unseasoned editor would want to work in this way. These judgments are extremely difficult for the unseasoned investor. Synonyms
green (NOT EXPERIENCED)
inexperiencedOpposites
experienced
seasoned (EXPERIENCED)
More examplesFewer examplesGrowth in house prices meant that even unseasoned landlords made significant profits.To my unseasoned eyes, this method has the best results.Unseasoned as he is, he is bound to make mistakes.
